item.title: A Legal Analysis of the DAO Exploit - Bitcoin News
item.description:
A Legal Analysis of the DAO Exploit - Bitcoin News

NOTHING IN THIS ANALYSIS IS LEGAL ADVICE. IF YOU NEED LEGAL ADVICE, SEEK OUT A QUALIFIED ATTORNEY. News broke early Friday morning that TheDao had been exploited using a code error in TheDao software that caused a user to be paid extra amounts of ETH held by TheDao when executing a split proposal which would create a new child Dao containing the extra ETH taken from TheDao.

item.title: The Tatiana Show - Philip Asare Of BTC Ghana | Lets Talk Bitcoin
item.description:
The Tatiana Show - Philip Asare Of BTC Ghana | Lets Talk Bitcoin

Tatiana and Josh interview Philip Agyei Asare of BTCGhana. (please note there were some technical difficulties during the recording of this episode but they do clear up during the second half of the show) Topics of discussion include real life uses of Bitcoin in Ghana, MoneyGrams in Africa, and mobile money systems. Philip is a libertarian, and a founder of Pak Universal Services and is also the founder of Dream Foundation Ghana.

item.title: Group of angry investors say Bitcoin startup had "hallmarks of a Ponzi scheme"
item.description:
Group of angry investors say Bitcoin startup had "hallmarks of a Ponzi scheme"

SEC: Josh Garza and GAW Miners "robbed one investor to pay another." An angry group of former customers have sued a collapsed Bitcoin mining company, GAW Miners, in a proposed class-action lawsuit, alleging that they were duped by the company and its founders.

item.title: The Impostor Emerges: Craig Wright Files 50+ Blockchain Patents
item.description:
The Impostor Emerges: Craig Wright Files 50+ Blockchain Patents

Also read: Recession on the Horizon: What Will a Downturn Mean for Bitcoin? The Australian, who claimed to be Satoshi Nakamoto, is now trying to secure many patents, according to his associates. Since the beginning of the year, Wright has filed over 50 patent applications in Britain, and Reuters has seen this data through documents given to the publication.

item.title: There could be a lot of money in claiming to have invented Bitoin
item.description:
There could be a lot of money in claiming to have invented Bitoin

This weekend, cryptocurrency watchers were bestowed with the London Review of Books' months-long, 35,000-word investigation into Craig Wright, the Australian man who claimed to be Satoshi Nakamoto, the pseudonymous creator of Bitcoin. Journalist Andrew O'Hagan brings us many curious details about Wright that ultimately raise more questions than they answer.

item.title: Currencies to watch in the wake of the 'Brexit' referendum
item.description:
Currencies to watch in the wake of the 'Brexit' referendum

On the 23rd of June the United Kingdom will hold a referendum to decide whether it should remain in the European Union or whether it should leave. On the 23 rd of June the United Kingdom will hold a referendum to decide whether it should remain in the European Union or whether it should leave.

item.title: Why the Wrong Response to The DAO Attack Could Kill Ethereum - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why the Wrong Response to The DAO Attack Could Kill Ethereum - CoinDesk

Edan Yago is CEO of Epiphyte, a company that provides financial institutions with the ability to perform transactions on the open blockchain. He is also a founding board member of the Digital Asset Transfer Authority (DATA).

item.title: Skype inventor Jaan Tallinn wants to use Bitcoin technology to save the world
item.description:
Skype inventor Jaan Tallinn wants to use Bitcoin technology to save the world

Mr Tallinn decided to apply blockchain principles to solve social ills after reading a blog asserting that humanity's biggest problems all have something in common. "They are all locked in an equilibrium where the players cannot change the outcome of the game," Mr Tallinn said.

item.title: Bitcoin Debit Cards: Convenience Vs. Drawbacks
item.description:
Bitcoin Debit Cards: Convenience Vs. Drawbacks

Many Bitcoin enthusiasts are using one - or multiple - of the available debit cards in circulation today. But there are some drawbacks to this system and a price to pay for convenience. Moving funds out of these third-party wallets, for example, can be rather tricky.

item.title: New Bitcoin Foundation Director Claasen 'Exactly What Is Needed'
item.description:
New Bitcoin Foundation Director Claasen 'Exactly What Is Needed'

The Bitcoin Foundation has "unanimously" voted for Llew Claasen to be its new Executive Director, replacing the incumbent Bruce Fenton. Also read: Bitcoin Foundation Has a Few Months Left, Recent Gift Not Enough Claasen's appointment was agreed at a vote June 14, the Foundation said in a press release issued today.
